structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Polls the configuration for one I/O port

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (see the other versions of CFG-PRT for valid values)

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (see Integration manual for valid UART port IDs)

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01)

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0 High-active, 1 Low-active)

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold (The given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. The TX ready PIN goes active after >= thres*8 bytes are pending for the port and going inactive after the last pending bytes have been written to hardware (0-4 bytes before end of stream). 0x000 no threshold, 0x001 8byte, 0x002 16byte, ..., 0x1FE 4080byte, 0x1FF 4088byte)

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00 5bit (not supported), 01 6bit (not supported), 10 7bit (supported only with parity), 11 8bit)

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity (000 Even parity, 001 Odd parity, 10X No parity, X1X Reserved)

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00 1 Stop bit, 01 1.5 Stop bit, 10 2 Stop bit, 11 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: This polymorphic message configures various port types (UART, USB, SPI, I2C). The payload structure for offsets 4-11 (mode and baudRate/reserved fields) varies significantly based on the 'portID' field. This definition primarily describes the structure for UART ports for fields 4-11, with notes on variations. Additionally, a distinct 'Poll request' variant of this message exists with a fixed payload length of 1 byte, containing only a U1 'portID' at offset 0, used to request a port's configuration.

variable.description: N configuration units. Input messages can concatenate units. Output messages always contain one config unit (N=1), thus having a fixed length of 20 bytes.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number. (e.g., 0 for I2C, 1 for UART1, 2 for UART2, 3 for USB, 4 for SPI)

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port. This field's interpretation of its bits is common across UART, USB, SPI, I2C ports.

bitfields.name: en
bitfields.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode. NOTE: This field (and subsequent 'baudRate' field) is specific to UART port configurations. For USB, this 8-byte block (offsets 4-11) is U1[8] reserved. For SPI and I2C, this block contains an X4 'mode' field (with different bitfields, e.g., spiMode for SPI, slaveAddr for I2C) and a U1[4] reserved field.

bitfields.name: charLen
bitfields.description: Character length (00: 5bit (not supported), 01: 6bit (not supported), 10: 7bit (supported only with parity), 11: 8bit)

bitfields.name: parity
bitfields.description: Parity (000: Even parity, 001: Odd parity, 10X: No parity, X1X: Reserved)

bitfields.name: nStopBits
bitfields.description: Number of Stop bits (00: 1 Stop bit, 01: 1.5 Stop bit, 10: 2 Stop bit, 11: 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second. NOTE: This field is specific to UART port configurations. For other port types, this memory region is used differently (e.g., reserved or part of other port-specific modes).

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Common across UART, USB, SPI, I2C ports.

bitfields.name: inRtcm3
bitfields.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Common across UART, USB, SPI, I2C ports.

bitfields.name: outRtcm3
bitfields.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask. Common across UART, USB, SPI, I2C ports. Bit 1, 'extendedTx', affects TX ready functionality.

bitfields.name: extendedTx
bitfields.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set, the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless of allocated TX memory (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

fields.name: reserved_final
fields.description: Reserved. (Named 'reserved1' or 'reserved2' in some port definitions, e.g., USB, SPI, I2C).

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Port configuration message. It can be used as a 1-byte poll request (payload contains only portID) or as a 20-byte configuration message for getting/setting port parameters. Multiple 20-byte configurations can be concatenated in an input message. This definition follows the UART port configuration as the primary structure.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number. Values: 0 for I2C (DDC), 1 for UART1, 2 for UART2, 3 for USB, 4 for SPI. This field determines the interpretation of subsequent payload fields.

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01)

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0: High-active, 1: Low-active)

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold (given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. The TX ready PIN goes active after >= thres*8 bytes are pending for the port and going inactive after the last pending bytes have been written to hardware (0-4 bytes before end of stream). Examples: 0x000 no threshold, 0x001 8byte, 0x002 16byte, 0x1FE 4080byte, 0x1FF 4088byte)

fields.name: mode
fields.description: This field's interpretation varies by port type. For UART ports (portID 1, 2), it describes the UART mode (see bitfield below). For SPI ports (portID 4), it describes SPI Mode Flags. For I2C ports (portID 0), it describes I2C (DDC) Mode Flags. For USB ports (portID 3), the entire 8-byte block from offset 4 to 11 is reserved.

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00: 5bit (not supported), 01: 6bit (not supported), 10: 7bit (supported only with parity), 11: 8bit)

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity (000: Even parity, 001: Odd parity, 10X: No parity, X1X: Reserved)

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00: 1 Stop bit, 01: 1.5 Stop bit, 10: 2 Stop bit, 11: 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second (applies to UART ports, portID 1, 2). For other port types, this 4-byte block (offset 8-11) may be reserved or part of port-specific configuration not explicitly detailed as a distinct field.

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Port configuration for I/O ports (UART, USB, SPI, I2C). This message is deprecated in protocol versions greater than 23.01. Use UBX-CFG-VALSET, UBX-CFG-VALGET, UBX-CFG-VALDEL instead.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number. Valid values depend on the port type: 0 for I2C (DDC), 1 for UART1, 2 for UART2, 3 for USB, 4 for SPI. See Integration manual for specific port IDs.

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01)

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0 High-active, 1 Low-active)

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold (given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. The TX ready PIN goes active after >= thres*8 bytes are pending for the port and going inactive after the last pending bytes have been written to hardware (0-4 bytes before end of stream). 0x000 no threshold, 0x001 8byte, ..., 0x1FF 4088byte)

fields.name: mode
fields.description: Mode flags for the respective port. Interpretation varies depending on portID. This bitfield definition reflects UART mode flags (portID = 1 or 2). For SPI (portID = 4), mode contains spiMode and ffCnt. For I2C (portID = 0), mode contains slaveAddr.

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00 5bit (not supported), 01 6bit (not supported), 10 7bit (supported only with parity), 11 8bit)

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity (000 Even parity, 001 Odd parity, 10X No parity, X1X Reserved)

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00 1 Stop bit, 01 1.5 Stop bit, 10 2 Stop bit, 11 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second. This field is specific to UART ports; other port types (USB, SPI, I2C) typically use these bytes as reserved fields ('reserved1').

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Polls or configures the port settings for an I/O port (e.g., UART, USB, SPI). This definition describes the 20-byte Get/Set configuration.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (see the other versions of CFG-PRT for valid values)

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0 High-active, 1 Low-active)

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold for TX ready PIN activation. The given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. Values like 0x000 (no threshold), 0x001 (8 bytes), 0x002 (16 bytes), ..., 0x1FE (4080 bytes), 0x1FF (4088 bytes).

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00 5bit (not supported), 01 6bit (not supported), 10 7bit (supported only with parity), 11 8bit)

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity setting (000 Even parity, 001 Odd parity, 10X No parity, X1X Reserved)

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00 1 Stop bit, 01 1.5 Stop bit, 10 2 Stop bit, 11 0.5 Stop bit)

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory.

fields.name: reserved2
fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Polls the configuration for one I/O port, or sets/gets the configuration for UART, USB, and SPI ports. When polling, a 1-byte message containing only the portID is sent as input, and the full 20-byte configuration unit is returned. For set/get operations, several 20-byte configuration units can be concatenated to one input message. Output messages from the module always contain only one 20-byte configuration unit. This message can affect baud rate and other transmission parameters. Changes may cause messages queued for transmission to be corrupted due to protocol changes; host data reception parameters may need adjustment to receive future messages including acknowledge messages.

variable.description: N is the number of concatenated configuration units (each 20 bytes long). A 1-byte payload is used for poll requests.

payload.name: portID
payload.description: Port identifier number (see Integration manual for valid port IDs). For USB, value is 3; for SPI, value is 4.

payload.name: txReady
payload.description: TX ready PIN configuration (bitfield): bit 0 (en): Enable TX ready; bit 1 (pol): Polarity (0=High-active, 1=Low-active); bits 2-4 (pin): PIO to be used; bits 5-15 (thres): Threshold (multiplied by 8 bytes, e.g., 0x000=no threshold, 0x001=8byte, 0x1FF=4088byte).

payload.name: mode
payload.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode (bitfield): bits 0-1 (charLen): Character length (e.g., 00=5bit, 11=8bit); bits 2-4 (parity): Parity (e.g., 000=Even, 10X=No parity); bits 6-7 (nStopBits): Number of Stop bits (e.g., 00=1 Stop bit, 11=0.5 Stop bit).

payload.name: inProtoMask
payload.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active (bitfield): bit 0 (inUbx): UBX protocol; bit 1 (inNmea): NMEA protocol; bit 2 (inRtcm): RTCM2 protocol; bit 5 (inRtcm3): RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20).

payload.name: outProtoMask
payload.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active (bitfield): bit 0 (outUbx): UBX protocol; bit 1 (outNmea): NMEA protocol; bit 5 (outRtcm3): RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20).

payload.name: flags
payload.description: Flags bit mask (bitfield): bit 1 (extendedTxTimeout): Extended TX timeout (if set, port times out if TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5s; if not set, port times out if no activity for 1.5s regardless of allocated TX memory).

fields.description: Port identifier number

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode

fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

bits.description: NMEA protocol

bits.name: inRtcm

bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00)

bits.description: UBX protocol

bits.description: NMEA protocol

fields.description: Reserved

structure.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
structure.description: Port configuration for I/O ports. This message is deprecated in protocol versions greater than 23.01. Use UBX-CFG-VALSET, UBX-CFG-VALGET, UBX-CFG-VALDEL instead. The payload structure varies based on the portID field.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (0=I2C, 1=UART1, 2=UART2, 3=USB, 4=SPI. See integration manual for valid port IDs).

fields.name: reserved0
fields.description: Reserved.

fields.name: txReady
fields.description: TX ready PIN configuration (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01).

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port.

bits.name: pol
bits.description: Polarity (0=High-active, 1=Low-active).

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function).

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold. The given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. (0x000 no threshold, 0x001 8byte, 0x002 16byte, ..., 0x1FE 4080byte, 0x1FF 4088byte).

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode. (Interpretation varies based on portID. For SPI, it contains spiMode and ffCnt. For I2C, it contains slaveAddr. Other bits may be reserved for non-UART ports.)

bits.name: charLen
bits.description: Character length (00=5bit, 01=6bit, 10=7bit, 11=8bit).

bits.name: parity
bits.description: Parity (000=Even parity, 001=Odd parity, 10X=No parity, X1X=Reserved).

bits.name: nStopBits
bits.description: Number of Stop bits (00=1 Stop bit, 01=1.5 Stop bit, 10=2 Stop bit, 11=0.5 Stop bit).

fields.name: baudRate
fields.description: Baud rate in bits/second (Applicable for UART only. For USB/SPI/I2C, this field is reserved).

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port. (The bitfield inRtcm3 is not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

bits.name: inUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol.

bits.name: inNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol.

bits.name: inRtcm
bits.description: RTCM2 protocol.

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port. (The bitfield outRtcm3 is not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

bits.name: outUbx
bits.description: UBX protocol.

bits.name: outNmea
bits.description: NMEA protocol.

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.00).

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Flags bit mask.

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5 s. (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01). (Applicable for UART/USB/SPI. Reserved for I2C.)

fields.name: reserved1_at_18
fields.description: Reserved.
